title: VPSRLVW/VPSRLVD/VPSRLVQ â€” Variable Bit Shift Right Logical

fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`VPSRLVD xmm1, xmm2, xmm3/m128`
`VPSRLVQ xmm1, xmm2, xmm3/m128`
`VPSRLVD ymm1, ymm2, ymm3/m256`
`VPSRLVQ ymm1, ymm2, ymm3/m256`
`VPSRLVW xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2, xmm3/m128`
`VPSRLVW ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2, ymm3/m256`
`VPSRLVW zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2, zmm3/m512`
`VPSRLVD xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2, xmm3/m128/m32bcst`
`VPSRLVD ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2, ymm3/m256/m32bcst`
`VPSRLVD zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2, zmm3/m512/m32bcst`
`VPSRLVQ xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2, xmm3/m128/m64bcst`
`VPSRLVQ ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2, ymm3/m256/m64bcst`
`VPSRLVQ zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2, zmm3/m512/m64bcst`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: Shifts the bits in the individual data elements (words, doublewords or quadword) in the first source operand to the right by the count value of respective data elements in the second source operand. As the bits in the data elements are shifted right, the empty high-order bits are cleared (set to 0).

fields.name: ​
fields.value: The count values are specified individually in each data element of the second source operand. If the unsigned integer value specified in the respective data element of the second source operand is greater than 15 (for word), 31 (for doublewords), or 63 (for a quadword), then the destination data element are written with 0.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VEX.128 encoded version: The destination and first source operands are XMM registers. The count operand can be either an XMM register or a 128-bit memory location. Bits (MAXVL-1:128) of the corresponding destination register are zeroed.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VEX.256 encoded version: The destination and first source operands are YMM registers. The count operand can be either an YMM register or a 256-bit memory. Bits (MAXVL-1:256) of the corresponding ZMM register are zeroed.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: EVEX encoded VPSRLVD/Q: The destination and first source operands are ZMM/YMM/XMM registers. The count operand can be either a ZMM/YMM/XMM register, a 512/256/128-bit memory location or a 512-bit vector broadcasted from a 32/64-bit memory location. The destination is conditionally updated with writemask k1.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: EVEX encoded VPSRLVW: The destination and first source operands are ZMM/YMM/XMM registers. The count operand can be either a ZMM/YMM/XMM register, a 512/256/128-bit memory location. The destination is conditionally updated with writemask k1.
